---
title: "dFDA vs FDA Efficiency"
description: "Side-by-side comparison showing dFDA is 82X more efficient than FDA trials"
doc-title: "dfda-comparison"
---

```{python}
#| label: dfda-comparison
#| fig-cap: "dFDA: Amazon for Clinical Trials"

import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'c:/code/decentralized-institutes-of-health')

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from brain.charts._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_DARK, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BG
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Data
comparison_data = {
    'Metric': ['Cost per\nPatient', 'Time to\nResults', 'Patient\nAccess'],
    'FDA': [41000, 17, 15],
    'dFDA': [500, 2, 100],
    'Unit': ['$', 'years', '%']
}

# Create chart
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(20, 10))

for idx, (ax, metric) in enumerate(zip(axes, comparison_data['Metric'])):
    fda_val = comparison_data['FDA'][idx]
    dfda_val = comparison_data['dFDA'][idx]
    unit = comparison_data['Unit'][idx]

    bars = ax.bar(['FDA', 'dFDA'], [fda_val, dfda_val],
                   color=[COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT], width=0.5, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3)

    # Add value labels
    for bar, val in zip(bars, [fda_val, dfda_val]):
        height = bar.get_height()
        label = f'{unit}{val:,.0f}' if unit == '$' else f'{val}{unit}'
        ax.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height,
                label, ha='center', va='bottom', fontsize=36, weight='bold', color=COLOR_DARK)

    ax.set_title(metric, fontsize=40, weight='bold', pad=20, color=COLOR_DARK)
    ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=32, colors=COLOR_DARK)
    ax.set_yticks([])
    clean_spines(ax, ['top', 'right', 'left'])

    # Add "82X Better" annotation for cost
    if idx == 0:
        ax.annotate('82X\nBetter', xy=(0.5, fda_val/2), fontsize=48, color=COLOR_ACCENT,
                   weight='bold', ha='center', va='center')

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

#plt.tight_layout()  # Disabled - using rcParams margins instead
plt.savefig('assets/charts/dfda-comparison.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches=None, facecolor=COLOR_BG)
plt.show()
```

**Key Insight:** The dFDA (Decentralized FDA) runs trials at **$500 per patient** (vs $41,000 FDA standard), delivers results in **2 years** (vs 17), and enables **100% patient access** (vs 15%). This is **82X more efficient**.
